Product Notation in Monoids

For a monoid $M$ and elements $a_{1}, \ldots, a_{n} \in M$, the product is defined as $\prod_{i=1}^{n} a_{i} := a_{1} \cdot \ldots \cdot a_{n}$. A special bracketing on the right-hand side is not necessary due to the associative nature of the law of composition.
Normal Subgroup
A subgroup $H \subset G$ is called a normal subgroup of $G$ if $aH = Ha$ for all $a \in G$, i.e., if for each element $a \in G$ the associated left and right cosets of $H$ in $G$ coincide.
Zero Divisor

An element a of a ring R is called a zero divisor if there exists an element b in R - {0} such that ab=0 or ba=0. Fields and skew fields do not admit any zero divisors, except for 0, the trivial zero divisor.
Principal Ideal Domain
A ring $R$ is called a principal ideal domain if it is an integral domain and every ideal of $R$ is principal.
Kernel of a Ring Homomorphism
Let $\varphi: R \longrightarrow R'$ be a ring homomorphism. The kernel of $\varphi$, denoted $\operatorname{ker} \varphi$, is defined as $\{a \in R ; \varphi(a)=0\}$, which is an ideal in $R$.
Localization of a Ring

Given a ring $R$ and a multiplicative system $S \subset R$, the localization $S^{-1}R$ (or $R_S$) is the ring of fractions $ rac{a}{s}$ where $a \in R$ and $s \in S$, under an equivalence relation defined by $ rac{a}{s} =  rac{a'}{s'}$ if there exists some $s'' \in S$ such that $as's'' = a'ss''$.
Purely Inseparable Extension
A purely inseparable extension is a field extension where the minimal polynomial of any element in the extension has a single root, which is repeated according to the degree of the polynomial.
Integral Ring Homomorphism
A ring homomorphism $\varphi: A \longrightarrow B$ is integral if every element $b \in B$ is integral over $A$ in the way described in the definition of an integral element over a ring.
Prime Subfield of a Finite Field
The prime subfield of a finite field $\\[\mathbb{F}\]$ is the smallest subfield contained within $\\[\mathbb{F}\]$, denoted as $\\[\mathbb{F}_p\]$, where $p=\operatorname{char} \\[\mathbb{F}\]>0$.
Galois extension
An extension $K_{r} / K$ is Galois if it is both normal and separable.
Element of a Set
An element of a set is an object belonging to a set.
Subset
A subset is a set where all of its elements are also contained within another set.
Inheritance_Analysis

Generalization_Specialization_Relationsh.Explanation: A normal subgroup (ID: 1) is a specific type of subset (ID: 11) where the subset also satisfies additional group-theoretic properties, making it a specialization of the general concept of a subset.
